intro: Myoxanthus pan, commonly known as the pan plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Myoxanthus pan is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained, sandy soils.
